column2: Lacking distinct organs, sponges exhibit a rather simple body plan that consists of a matrix containing few different cell types, of which the flagellated choanocytes gen-  * Corresponding author. In addition to these cells, many sponges harbor a rich assemblage of bacteria, archaea and eukaryotic microorganisms that are symbiotically associated (Hentschel et al., 2006; Taylor et al., 2007). Thus, a new set of predictive rules was established that should provide an excellent aid in the study of trans-acyltransferase polyketide synthases. myxalamide  stigmatellin  epothilone  mycobacterial cell wall lipids  0.1
